algorithm_technique: Calculate total chalk needed per round. Use modulo to find remaining chalk after full rounds, then simulate.
problem_summary_simple: Find which student needs to replace the chalk when it runs out, given chalk usage per student and initial chalk.
problem_summary_technical: Calculate the total chalk used per round. Use modulo arithmetic to find the remaining chalk and simulate the process.
key_insights: The process is cyclical. We can determine how many full rounds of students can complete their turns.
The total chalk used in one full round can be pre-calculated.
Using the modulo operator with the total chalk per round and the initial chalk `k` efficiently determines the state after many rounds.
